edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Grid grid
      The Grid object to be used in the game and referred to by the GameEngine
      private int playerDirection
      This is the direction the player is "facing" on the Grid
      private Taha thePlayer
      The Taha object to be used in the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEngine(Taha tahaPlayer)
      This constructor creates a Taha and Grid object and passes in the created Taha object into the Grid so the grid knows to interact with that Taha object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int ammo()
      Keeps track of the amount of ammo the player has left.
      boolean ammoCheck()
      This method checks if the player object has any ammo left to use.
      void callGridSeeAround()
      Calls the Grid.#playerSeeAround() method.
      void callGridSeeReset()
      Calls the Grid.#resetSeeAll() method.
      int cantDie()
      Keeps track of whether or not the player is invincible.
      void debug()
      Calls the grid's Grid.#debugMode() method to signal that the game should be in debug mode.
      boolean gameOverCheck()
      Keeps track of the amount of lives the player has left and ends the game if the player has no lives left.

      Gets the GridMember at a certain index in the array from the grid

      This method tells the grid which direction the user wants to move within the game.

      Calls on the Grid to look in a direction depending on input given by the user from the UserInterface

      This method gets information from the grid to check if the player has won the game yet.

    • Field Detail

      • thePlayer

        private Taha thePlayer
        The Taha object to be used in the game. It is passed into the Grid when it is created in the constructor for this class.

      • grid

        private Grid grid
        The Grid object to be used in the game and referred to by the GameEngine

      • playerDirection

        private int playerDirection
        This is the direction the player is "facing" on the Grid

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(Taha tahaPlayer)
        This constructor creates a Taha and Grid object and passes in the created Taha object into the Grid so the grid knows to interact with that Taha object.
        Parameters:
        tahaPlayer -

    • Method Detail

      • recieveWinFromGrid

        public boolean recieveWinFromGrid()
        This method gets information from the grid to check if the player has won the game yet.
        Returns:
        true if the player has won and false if they have not won.

      • debug

        public void debug()
        Calls the grid's Grid.#debugMode() method to signal that the game should be in debug mode.

      • playerTurnUsedWhileInvincible

        public void playerTurnUsedWhileInvincible()
        Keeps track of the turns that the player has left with the invincibility power up.

      • gameOverCheck

        public boolean gameOverCheck()
        Keeps track of the amount of lives the player has left and ends the game if the player has no lives left.
        Returns:
        true if the player has not lives left and false if the player still has lives left.

      • getGM

        public GridMember getGM(int row,
               int col)
        Gets the GridMember at a certain index in the array from the grid
        Parameters:
        row - the first index of the array
        col - the second index of the array
        Returns:
        the GridMember in that index.

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String direction)
        This method tells the grid which direction the user wants to move within the game. It uses a switch statement to call the Grid.#movePlayer(int, int) method according to what information was passed in by the UserInterface.
        Parameters:
        direction - value passed in by the UserInterface that decides what information will be passed to the Grid via this method.

      • playerLook

        public void playerLook(java.lang.String direction)
        Calls on the Grid to look in a direction depending on input given by the user from the UserInterface
        Parameters:
        direction - value to be passed to the Grid.#look(String) method.

      • getPlayerDirection

        public int getPlayerDirection()
        Used to get the player direction.
        Returns:
        playerDirection

      • callGridSeeAround

        public void callGridSeeAround()
        Calls the Grid.#playerSeeAround() method.

      • callGridSeeReset

        public void callGridSeeReset()
        Calls the Grid.#resetSeeAll() method.

      • getPlayer

        public Taha getPlayer()
        Gets the Taha object used in the game.
        Returns:
        thePlayer

      • lives

        public int lives()
        Keeps track of the amount of lives the player has left. It uses the Taha.#showLives() method to keep track of the lives.
        Returns:
        the amount of lives the player has left.

      • ammo

        public int ammo()
        Keeps track of the amount of ammo the player has left. It uses the Taha.#showAmmo() method.
        Returns:
        the amount of ammo the player has left.

      • cantDie

        public int cantDie()
        Keeps track of whether or not the player is invincible. It uses the Taha.#showCantDieTime() method.
        Returns:
        the amount of turns the player has left invincible.

      • shootDirection

        public void shootDirection(int shootChoice)
        Gets information from the UserInterface regarding which direction the user wants to shoot, if they choose to do so. It passes that value into the Grid.#shootDirection(int) method.
        Parameters:
        shootChoice - the direction the user wants to shoot in.

      • ammoCheck

        public boolean ammoCheck()
        This method checks if the player object has any ammo left to use. It uses the Taha.#showAmmo() method to keep track of this value.
        Returns:
        true if the player has ammo or false if they do not.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Taha player)
        Manually sets the Taha object for use in the Grid
        Parameters:
        player - the Taha object to be used in the Grid
